lines.gurmukhi: 2 gur is`KI

Shabad OS B.translation: Discipleship of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI bwrIk hY isl ctx iPkI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Baareek Hai Sil Chatanu Dhikee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To be disciple of the Guru is very subtle activity and it is like licking of the tasteless stone.

lines.gurmukhi: iqKI KMfy Dwr hY auh vwlhuN inkI
lines.transliteration_english: Trikhee Khanday Dhaar Hai Uhu Vaalahu Nikee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is thinner than the hair and sharper than the edge of the sword.

lines.gurmukhi: BUh BivK n vrqmwn sir imkix imkI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhooh Bhavikh N Varatamaan Sari Mikani Mikee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nothing is equal to it in present, past and future.

lines.gurmukhi: duqIAw nwsiq eyqu Gir hoie iekw iekI
lines.transliteration_english: Douteeaa Naasati Aytu Ghari Hoi Ikaa Ikee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the house of Sikhism, the duality gets erased and one becomes one with that One.

lines.gurmukhi: dUAw qIAw vIsrY sx kkw ikkI
lines.transliteration_english: Dooaa Teeaa Veesarai Sanu Kakaa Kikee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man forgets the idea of second, third, when and why.

lines.gurmukhi: sBY iskwN prhrY suKu iekqu iskI ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhai Sikaan Paraharai Soukhu Ikatu Sikee ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Repudiating all the desires, the individual gets delight in the hope of one Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gurmuKqweI

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrgu AwKIAY gurmiq ihqkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragu Aakheeai Guramati Hitakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way leading to the adoption of beneficent wisdom of the Guru (Gurmat) is known as the Gurmukh-way.

lines.gurmukhi: hukim rjweI clxw gur sbd vIcwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Houkami Rajaaee Chalanaa Gur Sabad Veechaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In it one is taught to live in the will of the Lord and to ponder upon the Word of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwxw BwvY Ksm kw inhcau inrMkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaanaa Bhaavai Khasam Kaa Nihachau Nirankaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The will of the Master comes to be loved and in all thoughts permeates the formless Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: iesk musk mhkwr hY huie praupkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Isak Mousak Mahakaaru Hai Hui Paraoupakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: As love and fragrance do not remain hidden, the Gurmukh also does not remain concealed and gets himself busy in altruistic activities.

lines.gurmukhi: isdk sbUrI swbqy msqI husIAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Sidak Sabooree Saabatay Masatee Houseeaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He imbibes in him the faith, contentment, ecstasy, and the qualities of being skilful.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awpu gvwieAw ijix haumY mwrI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaaiaa Jini Haoumai Maaree ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh decimates ego and conquers it.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 is`K dI krnI

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct of a Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq BY clxw hoie pwhuixcwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Chalanaa Hoi Paahounichaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering himself a guest, the sikh spends his life in loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: clxu jwix Ajwx hoie ghu grbu invwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Chalanu Jaani Ajaanu Hoi Gahu Garabu Nivaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: They (Sikhs) remain unknown to deceit and pull out ego from their minds.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK inq prwhuxy ieh krxI swrI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Nit Paraahounay Ayhu Karanee Saaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Their true conduct is to treat themselves as guests in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK syv kmwvxI siqgurU ipAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sayv Kamaavanee Satiguroo Piaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The object of the Gurmukh is service and only such action is loved by the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: sbid suriq ilvlIx hoie prvwr suDwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Liv Leen Hoi Paravaar Sudhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merging consciousness in the Word they reform the whole family (in the form of world).

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq jwie shj Gir inrmil inrMkwrI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Jaai Sahaj Ghari Niramali Nirankaaree ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through holy congregation they become pure and formless and get established in the final stage of equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 gur isK dI Awqm Kyf

Shabad OS B.translation: The spiritual sport of the gursikh

lines.gurmukhi: prm joiq prgwsu kir aunmin ilvlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Param Joti Paragaasu Kari Ounamani Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kindling the supreme light in his mind a gurmukh remains absorbed in the state of supreme trance.

lines.gurmukhi: prm qqu prvwxu kir Anhid Duin vweI
lines.transliteration_english: Param Tatu Paravaanu Kari Anahadi Dhouni Vaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When he adopts the supreme reality (Lord) in his mind, the unstruck melody starts ringing.

lines.gurmukhi: prmwrQ prboD kir prmwqm hweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paramaarad Parabodh Kari Paramaatam Haaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming conscious for altruism now resides in his heart the sense of God’s omnipresence.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu Avysu kir AnBau pd pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Anabhau Padu Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Inspired by the teachings of the Guru, gurmukh attains the state of fearlessness.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq kir swDnw iek min ieku iDAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Kari Saadhanaa Ik Mani Iku Dhiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Disciplining himself in the company in the holy ones i.e. losing his ego, he remembers Lord with single-minded devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVHwau cViH ieauN inj Gir jweI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Charhhi Ioun Nij Ghari Jaaee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way, entering from this world into the spiritual world, he finally establishes himself in his real nature.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 inj srUpk vwihgurU vRXwpkqw dw AnBY

Shabad OS B.translation: Realization of the all-pervasiveness of the wondrous Guru

lines.gurmukhi: drpix vwNig iDAwnu Dir Awpu Awp inhwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Darapani Vaang Dhiaanu Dhari Aapu Aap Nihaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As is the reflection in the mirror.  He sees in the world His ownself.

lines.gurmukhi: Git Git pUrn bHmu hY cMdu jl ivic BwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghati Ghati Pooran Brahamu Hai Chandu Jal Vichi Bhaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: That perfect Lord is there in all the selves; the ignorant individual searches Him outside as the moon sees its own reflection in the water and feels it is there.

lines.gurmukhi: gorsu gweI vyKdw iGau duD ivcwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Gorasu Gaaee Vaykhadaa Ghiu Dudhu Vichaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord Himself is there in the milk, cow and ghee.

lines.gurmukhi: PulwN AMdir vwsu lY Plu swau smHwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Phulaan Andari Vaasu Lai Phalu Saau Samhaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Taking fragrance from the flowers He Himself is the flavour in them.

lines.gurmukhi: kwsit Agin cilqu vyiK jl Driq ihAwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaasati Agani Chalitu Vaykhi Jal Dharati Hiaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: His own phenomenon is there in wood, fire, water, earth and snow.

lines.gurmukhi: Git Git pUrnu bHmu hY gurmuiK vyKwlY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Ghati Ghati Pooranu Brahamu Hai Guramoukhi Vaykhaalai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: The perfect Lord resides in all the selves and is visualised by a rare gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 AYsy is`K dI rihxI

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct of a Sikh of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: idb idsit gur iDAwnu Dir isK ivrlw koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Dib Disati Gur Dhiaanu Dhari Sikh Viralaa Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare is the gurmukh  who concentrates upon the Guru and attains the divine sight.

lines.gurmukhi: rqn pwrKU hoie kY rqnw AvloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Paarakhoo Hoi Kai Ratanaa Avaloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the jeweller having the capacity of testing as well as keeping the jewels in the from of virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: mnu mwxku inrmolkw siqsMig proeI
lines.transliteration_english: Manu Maanaku Niramolakaa Satisangi Paroee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His mind becomes pure like ruby and he remains absorbed in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: rqnmwl gurisK jig gurmiq gux goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanamaal Gurasikh Jagi Guramati Goun Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His mind becomes pure like ruby and he remains absorbed in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: jIvidAwN mir Amru hoie suK shij smoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevadiaan Mari Amaru Hoi Soukh Sahaji Samoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is dead while being alive i.e. he turns his face from evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: Eiq poiq joqI joiq imil jwxY jwxoeI ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Aotipoti Jotee Joti Mili Jaanai Jaanoee ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Totally merging himself in the supreme light he understands his self as well as the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 AYsw is`K gurU nwl AByd

Shabad OS B.translation: Indenticalness of the Sikh with the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd ivsmwdu hoie gux gihr gMBIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Visamaadu Hoi Goun Gahir Ganbheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Elated in the music and sound (of the word), the disciple of the Guru becomes full of serene qualities.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIx hoie Anhd Duin DIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Hoi Anahadi Dhouni Dheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His consciousness gets merged into the Word and his mind stabilizes in the unstruck melody.

lines.gurmukhi: jMqRRI jMqRR vjwiedw min aunmin cIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jantree Jantr Vajaaidaa Manni Ounimani Cheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru plays upon the instrument of sermon, listening to which the mind dones clothes of the highest state of equipoise (to dance before the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: vij vjwie smwie lY gur sbd vjIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaji Vajaai Samaai Lai Gur Sabad Vajeeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru, getting attuned to the instrument of teaching ultimately turns out himself to be a player of the Guru Word.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqirjwmI jwxIAY AMqirgiq pIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Antarijaamee Jaaneeai Antarigati Peeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the omniscient Lord understands his pangs of separation.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw cylw gurU byiD hIrY hIrw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Baydhi Heerai Heeraa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: The disciple transforms into Guru and the guru into disciple in the same manner, as the diamond cutter in fact is also a diamond.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 qQwc

Shabad OS B.translation: Indenticalness of the Sikh with the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: pwrsu hoieAw pwrshuN gurmuiK vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasu Hoiaa Paarasahu Guramoukhi Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The greatness of the gurmukh is that he being the philosopher’s stone makes every one a philosopher’s stone.

lines.gurmukhi: hIrY hIrw byiDAw joqI joiq imlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Heerai Heeraa Baydhiaa Jotee Joti Milaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the diamond is cut by the diamond, the light of the gurmukh merges in Supreme Light.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIxu hoie jMqR jMqRRI vweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Jantr Jantree Vaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His consciousness is attuned to the Word as the mind of the player absorbs in the instrument.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw cylw gurU prcw prcweI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Parachaa Parachaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the disciple and the Guru become identical.  They become one and merge in one another.

lines.gurmukhi: purKhuM purKu aupwieAw purKoqm hweI
lines.transliteration_english: Purakhahoun Purakhu Oupaaiaa Purakhotam Haaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From man was born man (from Guru Nanak to Guru Angad) and he became the superior man.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh aulMiG kY hoie shij smweI ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Kai Hoi Sahaji Samaaee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing the world with one jump he merged in the innate knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 swD sMgq scKMf

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation, abode the truth -

lines.gurmukhi: siqgurU drsnu dyKdo prmwqmu dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Darasanu Daykhado Paramaatamu Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who beholds the true Guru has beholden the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIx hoie AMqirgiq lyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Hoi Antarigati Laykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Putting his consciousness into the Word he concentrates upon his self.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kvl dI vwsnw hoie cMdn ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Dee Vaasanaa Hoi Chandan Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enjoying the fragrance of the lotus feet of the Guru he transforms himself into sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: crxodk mkrMd rs ivsmwdu ivsyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodak Makarand Ras Visamaadu Visaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tasting the nectar of the lotus feet he goes into a special wondrous state (of super consciousness).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq inhcl icqu kir ivic rUp n ryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Nihachalu Chitu Kari Vichi Roop N Raykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now in consonance with the Gurmat, the wisdom of the Guru, he stabilizing the mind goes beyond the boundaries of forms and figures.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scKMif jwie hoie AlK AlyKY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sach Khandi Jaai Hoi Alakh Alaykhai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching the holy congregation, the abode of truth, he himself becomes like that imperceptible and ineffable Lord

lines.gurmukhi: 11 swKI AvsQw

Shabad OS B.translation: Witness state

lines.gurmukhi: AKI AMdir dyKdw drsn ivic idsY
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Andari Daykhadaa Darasan Vichi Disai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who sees from inside the eyes, is in fact beholden outside also.

lines.gurmukhi: sbdY ivic vKwxIAY surqI ivic irsY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadai Vichi Vakhaaneeai Suratee Vichi Risai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is described through words and He is illumined in the consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl ivic vwsnw mnu Bvru silsY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Vichi Vaasanaa Manu Bhavaru Salisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: For the fragrance of the lotus feet of the Guru, the mind, becoming the black bee, enjoys the pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq sMjogu imil ivjoig n iksY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sanjogu Mili Vijogi N Kisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever is attained in the holy congregation, he gets not away from it.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq AMdir icqu hY icqu gurmiq ijsY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Andari Chitu Hai Chitu Guramati Jisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By putting the mind into the teachings of the Guru, the mind itself changes according to the wisdom of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrx bHmu siqgurU hY iqsY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Pooran Brahamu Satigur Hai Tisai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the form of that transcendental Brahm who is beyond all the qualities.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 eISÍrIX gux

Shabad OS B.translation: Godly Virtues

lines.gurmukhi: AKI AMdir idsit hoie nik swhu sMjoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Andari Disati Hoi Naki Saahu Sanjoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is sight in the eyes and breath in the nostril.

lines.gurmukhi: kMnwN AMdir suriq hoie jIB swdu smoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Kannaan Andari Surati Hoi Jeebh Saadu Samoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is consciousness in the ears and taste in the tongue.

lines.gurmukhi: hQI ikriq kmwvxI pYr pMQu sQoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Hadee Kirati Kamaavanee Pair Pandu Sadoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With hands He works and becomes fellow traveller on the path.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pwieAw miq sbid ivloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiaa Mati Sabadi Viloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh has attained the fruit of delight after churning the Word with consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: prikrqI hUM bwhrw gurmuiK ivrloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Parakiratee Hoo Baaharaa Guramoukhi Viraloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare gurmukh remains away from the effects of maya.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq cMnx ibrKu imil cMnx hoeI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Channan Birakhu Mili Channanu Hoee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The holy congregation is a sandal tree to which whosoever becomes sandal

lines.gurmukhi: 13 vwihgurU mMqR

Shabad OS B.translation: Wahiguru mantar

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq Aibgiq dI ikau AlK lKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Abigat Gati Abigat Dee Kiu Alakhu Lakhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: How is the dynamism of the Unmanifest known?

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw hY AkQ dI ikau AwiK suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Hai Akad Dee Kiu Aakhi Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can the story of that ineffable Lord be told?

lines.gurmukhi: Acrj no Awcrj hY hYrwx krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Acharaj No Aacharaju Hai Hairaan Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is wonderful for the wonder itself.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsmwdy ivsmwdu hY ivsmwdu smwey
lines.transliteration_english: Visamaaday Visamaadu Hai Visamaadu Samaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The absorbents in the wondrous realization get themselves elated.

lines.gurmukhi: vydu n jwxY Bydu ikhu sysnwgu n pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Vaydu N Jaanai Bhaydu Kihu Saysanaagu N Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Vedas also do not understand this mystery and even the Sesanag (mythological snake having thousand hoods) cannot know its limits.

lines.gurmukhi: vwihgurU swlwhxw guru sbd Alwey ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Vaahiguroo Saalaahanaa Guru Sabadu Alaaay ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Vahiguru, God, is eulogised through recitation of the Word of the Guru, Gurbani.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 gurmuK gux

Shabad OS B.translation: Virtues in a Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: lIhw AMdir clIAY ijau gwfI rwhu
lines.transliteration_english: Leehaa Andari Chaleeai Jiu Gaadee Raahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: As, a coach on the highway goes through the beaten tracks,

lines.gurmukhi: hukim rjweI clxw swDsMgu inbwhu
lines.transliteration_english: Houkami Rajaaee Chalanaa Saadhasangi Nibaahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congregation one goes on abiding with the divine ordinance (hukam) and will of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau Dn soGw rKdw Gir AMdir swhu
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Dhan Soghaa Rakhadaa Ghari Andari Saahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: As, the wise person keeps money intact at home

lines.gurmukhi: ijau imrjwd n CfeI swieru Asgwhu
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mirajaad N Chhadaee Saairu Asagaahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the deep ocean leaves not its general nature;

lines.gurmukhi: lqw hyiT lqwVIAY Ajrwvr Gwhu
lines.transliteration_english: Lataa Haytdi Lataarheeai Ajaraavaru Ghaahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the grass is trampled under the feet,

lines.gurmukhi: Drmswl hY mwnsr hMs gurisK vwhu
lines.transliteration_english: Dharamasaal Hai Maanasaru Hans Gurasikh Vaahu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like this (earth) inn is the Manasarovar and the disciples of the Guru are swans

lines.gurmukhi: rqn pdwrQ gur sbdu kir kIrqnu Kwhu ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Padaarad Gur Sabadu Kari Keeratanu Khaahu ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Who in the form of kirtan, singing of the holy hymns, eat the pearls of the Word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 cMnxwid diRsStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of sandal

lines.gurmukhi: cMnxu ijau vxKMf ivic Ehu Awpu lukwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chananu Jiu Van Khand Vichi Aohu Aapu Loukaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the sandal tree tries to conceal itself in the forest (but cannot remain hidden),

lines.gurmukhi: pwrsu AMdir prbqw hoie gupq vlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasu Andari Parabataan Hoi Goupat Valaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The philosopher’s stone being identical with ordinary stones in the mountains spends its time in hiding.

lines.gurmukhi: sq smuMdI mwnsru nih AlKu lKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Samoundee Maanasaru Nahi Alakhu Lakhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The seven seas are manifest but the Manasarovar remains invisible to common eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau priCMnw pwrjwq nih prgtI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Parachhinnaa Paarajaatu Nahi Paragatee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: As parijat, wish fulfilling tree, also keeps itself unseen;

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jig AMdir kwmDynu nih Awp jxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jagi Andir Kaamadhaynu Nahi Aapu Janaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kamaddhenu, wish fulfilling cow, also lives in this world but never makes itself noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur dw aupdysu lY ikau Awpu gxwey ]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Daa Oupadaysu Lai Kiu Aapu Ganaaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise why should they who have adopted the teachings of the true Guru, include themselves in any count.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 gur cylw, cylw gurU

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru disciple, disciple Guru ,

lines.gurmukhi: duie duie AKI AwKIAin iek drsnu idsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Dui Akhee Aakheeani Iku Darasanu Disai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eyes are two but they behold the one (Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: duie duie kMn vKwxIAin iek suriq silsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Dui Kanni Vakhaaneeani Ik Surati Salisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ears are two but they bring out the one consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: duie duie ndI iknwirAwN pwrwvwru n iqsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Dui Nadee Kinaariaan Paaraavaaru N Tisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The river has two banks but they are one through the connection of water and are not separate.

lines.gurmukhi: iek joiq duie mUrqI iek sbd sirsY
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Joti Dui Mooratee Ik Sabadu Sarisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru and the disciple are two identities but one shabad, Word permeates through both of them.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw cylw gurU smJwey iksY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Samajhaaay Kisai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: When the Guru is disciple and the disciple Guru, who can make the other understand.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 gurU cyly dw kMm

Shabad OS B.translation: Activity of the disciple Guru

lines.gurmukhi: pihly gur aupdys dy isK pYrI pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pahilay Guri Oupadays Day Sikh Pairee Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: First the Guru making the disciple sit near his feet preaches to him.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq kir Drmswl isK syvw lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Kari Dharamasaal Sikh Sayvaa Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Telling him about the distinction of the holy congregation and the abode of dharma, he is put into the service (of the mankind).

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq BY syvdy gurpurb krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Sayvaday Gurapurab Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Serving through loving devotion, the servants of the Lord celebrate the anniversaries.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv kIrqnu sic myil imlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Keeratanu Sachi Mayli Malaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Attuning the consciousness with the Word, through the singing of hymns, one meets the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrgu sc dw scu pwr lMGwey
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragu Sach Daa Sachu Paari Laghaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh walks the path of Truth; practicing Truth he crosses the Worldly ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: sic imlY sicAwr no imil Awpu gvwey ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Sachi Milai Sachiaar No Mili Aapu Gavaaay ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus the truthful one obtains the truth and getting it, the ego is erased.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 crnwN qoN inMmRqw dw aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Learning humility from feet

lines.gurmukhi: isr aucw nIvy crx isir pYrI pwNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Ouchaa Neevayn Charan Siri Pairee Paanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The head is high and the feet are at a low level but still the head bows upon the feet.

lines.gurmukhi: muhu AKI nk kMn hQ dyh Bwr aucwNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Muhu Akhee Naku Kann Had Dayh Bhaar Ouchaanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The feet carry the burden of mouth, eyes, nose, ears, hands and the whole body.

lines.gurmukhi: sB ichn Cif pUjIAin kauxu krm kmwNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Chihan Chhadi Poojeeani Kaounu Karam Kamaanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then, leaving aside all the body organs, only they (feet) are worshipped.

lines.gurmukhi: gur srxI swDsMgqI inq cil cil jwNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Saranee Saadhasangatee Nit Chali Chali Jaanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They daily go to the holy congregation in the shelter of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: vqin praupkwr no kir pwir vswNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Vatani Paraoupakaar No Kari Paari Vasaanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then they run for the altruistic works and accomplish the work to the maximum possible.

lines.gurmukhi: myrI KlhuM mOjVy gurisK hMFwNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Mayree Khalahu Maujarhay Gurasikh Handdhaanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Alas! Were it so that shoes made of my skin were used by the Sikhs of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: msqk lgy swD ryxu vfBwg ijnHwN dy ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Masatak Lagay Saadh Raynu Vadabhaagi Jinhaan Day ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whosoever gets the dust of the feet of such people (with above virtues) he is fortunate and a blessed one.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 DrqI qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Learning from the earth

lines.gurmukhi: ijau DrqI DIrj Drmswl mskInI mUVI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Dharatee Dheeraj Dharamu Masakeenee Moorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the earth is embodiment of continence, dharma and humility,

lines.gurmukhi: sBdUM nIvIN hoie rhI iqs mxI n kUVI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhadoon Neeveen Hoi Rahee Tis Manee N Koorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It remains under the feet and this humility is true and not false.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI hirmMdru krY ko krY ArUVI
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Harimandaru Karai Ko Karai Aroorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Somebody constructs temple of god on it and some gather rubbish heaps on it.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw bIjY so luxY Pl AMb lsUVI
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Phal Anb Lasoorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever is sowed is got accordingly whether is be a mango or lasuri, a glutinous fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: jIvidAwN mir jIvxw juiV gurmuiK jUVI
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevadiaan Mari Jeevanaa Jurhi Guramoukhi Joorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: While being dead in life i.e. deleting ego from the self, the gurmukhs  join gurmukhs in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: lqwN hyiT lqwVIAY giq swDwN DUVI ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Lataan Haytdi Lataarheeai Gati Saadhaan Dhoorhee ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: They become the dust of the feet of the holy men, which is trampled under the feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 jl qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Learning from water

lines.gurmukhi: ijau pwxI iniv cldw nIvwix clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Paanee Nivi Chaladaa Neevaani Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As water flows downwards and takes with it whosoever meets it (and makes it also humble),

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw rMgwN no imlY ril jwie rlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaa Rangaan No Milai Rali Jaai Ralaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the dyes mix up in water and it becomes one with every colour;

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwr kmwvdw auin Awpu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaar Kamaanvadaa Ouni Aapu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Erasing ego it does altruistic deeds;

lines.gurmukhi: kwTu n fobY pwil kY sMig lohu qrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaatdu N Dobai Paali Kai Sangi Lohu Taraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It does not sink the wood, it rather makes the iron swim with it;

lines.gurmukhi: vuTy mIh sukwlu hoie rs ks aupjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Voutday Meeh Soukaalu Hoi Ras Kas Oupajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It makes for prosperity when it rains in rainy season.

lines.gurmukhi: jIvidAw mir swD hoie sPilE jig AwieAw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevadiaa Mari Saadh Hoi Saphaliao Jagi Aaiaa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the holy saints getting dead in life i.e. removing their ego, making their coming to the world fruitful.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 biR`C qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Learning from tree

lines.gurmukhi: isr qlvwieAw jMimAw hoie Aclu n cilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Talavaaiaa Janmiaa Hoi Achalu N Chaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With feet upward and head down, the tree gets rooted and stands unmoved.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pwlw Dup sih auh qphu n tilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Paalaa Dhoup Sahi Uh Tapahu N Taliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It bears with water, cold and sunshine but does not turn its face from self-mortification.

lines.gurmukhi: sPilE ibrK suhwvVw Pl suPlu suPilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saphaliao Birakh Suhaavarhaa Phal Suphalu Suphaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a tree is blessed one and becomes full of fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl dyie v`t vgwieAY krviq n hilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Phalu Dayi Vat Vagaaiai Karavati N Haliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On stoning, it gives fruit and does not stir even under the sawing machine.

lines.gurmukhi: bury krin buirAweIAw BilAweI BilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Buray Karani Buriaaeeaan Bhaliaaee Bhaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wicked go on doing evil deeds whereas the gentle remain busy in good activities.

lines.gurmukhi: Avgux kIqy gux krin jig swD ivrilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Avagoun Keetay Goun Karani Jagi Saadh Viraliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are the people in world who with their saintly heart do good to the evil.

lines.gurmukhi: Aausir Awp ClwieNdw iqnw Aausru CilAw ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Aousari Aap Chhalaainday Tinhaan Aousaru Chhaliaa ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: The commoners are duped by time i.e. they change according to the time, but the holy men succeed in deluding the time i.e. they remain free from the influence of time.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: drsn dyKq hI suiD kI n suiD rhI buiD kI n buiD rhI miq mY n miq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Darasan Daykhat Hee Sudhi Kee N Sudhi Rahee , Budhi Kee N Budhi Rahee Mati Mai N Mati Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A glimpse of (Satguru) left me bereft of all my consciousness, senses, intelligence, cleverness and all other considered wisdom of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: suriq mY n suriq Aau iDAwn mY n iDAwnu rihE igAwn mY n igAwn rihE giq mY n giq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Surati Mai N Surati Au Dhiaan Mai N Dhiaanu Rahiao , Giaan Mai N Giaan Rahiao Gati Mai N Gati Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: I lost my awareness, attachment of mind with insignificant matters, desires to acquire base or futile ego inflating knowledge and other worldly predicaments.

lines.gurmukhi: DIrju ko DIrju grb ko grbu gieE riq mY n riq rhI piq riq piq mY
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeraju Ko Dheeraju Garab Ko Garabu Gaiao , Rati Mai N Rati Rahee Pati Rati Pati Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: My patience was lost and so was my vanity. There was no life in me and I was bereft of my existence even.

lines.gurmukhi: AdBuq prmdBuq ibsmY ibsm AscrjY Ascrj Aiq Aiq hY ]1]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Adabhout Paramadabhout Bisamai Bisama , Asacharajai Asacharaj Ati Ati Hai ?1?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of Satguru is capable of amazing one with wondrous feelings. These are astonishing and marvellous and there is no end to this amazement. (9)
